election_record.label: Massachusetts 1813 Governor

overview.note: In both Town of Boston, Town records, 333, and in The Weekly Messenger April 9, 1813, William Eustis is listed as receiving 8 votes. The Official Returns from the State does not list William Eustis at all.

sub_unit.name: Falmouth
sub_unit.note: The votes from Falmouth were rejected.
"The returns from Falmouth was rejected, not having been signed by the Town Clerk." Columbian Centinel. Massachusetts Federalist (Boston, MA). May 29, 1813.

sub_unit.name: Dalton
sub_unit.note: The votes from Dalton were rejected.

"The returns from Dalton, Raymond and Pejepscot were rejected because they did not certify that the votes had been counted, and sorted, or that a record of the list had been recorded, or declaration made of the same in town meeting, as required by the Constitution." Columbian Centinel. Massachusetts Federalist (Boston, MA). May 29, 1813.

sub_unit.name: Bridgetown
sub_unit.note: Harrison G. Otis received 1 vote as H. G. Otis.

sub_unit.name: Lundts Grant Plantation
sub_unit.note: The votes from Lundts Grant Plantation were not listed in the Original Election Returns.

sub_unit.name: Pejepscot
sub_unit.note: The votes from Pejepscot were rejected.

"The returns from Dalton, Raymond and Pejepscot were rejected because they did not certify that the votes had been counted, and sorted, or that a record of the list had been recorded, or declaration made of the same in town meeting, as required by the Constitution." Columbian Centinel. Massachusetts Federalist (Boston, MA). May 29, 1813.

sub_unit.name: Raymond
sub_unit.note: The votes from Raymond were rejected.

"The returns from Dalton, Raymond and Pejepscot were rejected because they did not certify that the votes had been counted, and sorted, or that a record of the list had been recorded, or declaration made of the same in town meeting, as required by the Constitution." Columbian Centinel. Massachusetts Federalist (Boston, MA). May 29, 1813.

sub_unit.name: Thompson Pond and Shakers Settlement
sub_unit.note: The votes from Thompson Pond and Shakers Settlement were not listed in the Original Election Returns.

sub_unit.name: Essex
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns list Stephen Decatur with 1 vote but do not list which town the vote was in.

sub_unit.name: Danvers
sub_unit.note: Joseph B. Varnum received 2 votes as Joseph Varnum.

sub_unit.name: Salem
sub_unit.note: Joseph B. Varnum received 1 vote as Joseph Varnum.

sub_unit.name: Colrain
sub_unit.note: Joseph B. Varnum received 1 vote as Joseph Farnum.

sub_unit.name: Greenfield
sub_unit.note: In the town of Greenfield (Franklin), the votes for Governor as cast and reported were Caleb Strong 141 and Joseph B. Varnum 78. The votes for Lt. Governor as cast and reported were William Phillips 141, William B. King 78. The votes for Governor as listed in the Official Returns were Caleb Strong 141, Joseph B. Varnum 141 and for Lt. Governor the votes in the Official Returns were William Phillips 78 and William B. King 78.

sub_unit.name: Northfield
sub_unit.note: The votes from Northfield were rejected.
"The supposed intended return from Northfield was all in blank." Columbian Centinel. Massachusetts Federalist (Boston, MA). May 29, 1813.

sub_unit.name: Warwick
sub_unit.note: The votes from Warwick were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Chesterfield
sub_unit.note: The votes from Chesterfield were rejected.
"Rec'd 12 May (too late)." Original Election Returns.

"The returns from Malden, Chesterfield and Denmark were not made to the Secretary's office until after the expiration of the time prescribed by the Constitution for making them." Columbian Centinel. Massachusetts Federalist (Boston, MA). May 29, 1813.

sub_unit.name: Greene Plantation
sub_unit.note: The votes from Greene Plantation were not listed in the Original Election Returns.

sub_unit.note: The votes from Jackson Plantation were not listed in the Original Election Returns.

sub_unit.note: The votes from Knox Plantation were not listed in the Original Election Returns.

sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Lea Gore.

sub_unit.note: The votes from Lee Plantation were not listed in the Original Election Returns.

sub_unit.note: The votes from Lincoln Plantation were not listed in the Original Election Returns.

sub_unit.note: The votes from Swans Plantation were not listed in the Original Election Returns.

sub_unit.name: Kennebec
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns list a total of 1 vote in Kennebec County for William King but there are two separate votes listed for him in the town totals.

sub_unit.note: The votes from Beaverhill Plantation were not listed in the Original Election Returns.

sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Bridgetown Plantation.

sub_unit.name: Montville
sub_unit.note: The votes from Montville were rejected.
"The Montville return was rejected because signed by only one Selectman." Columbian Centinel. Massachusetts Federalist (Boston, MA). May 29, 1813.

"The returns from Malden, Chesterfield and Denmark were not made to the Secretary's office until after the expiration of the time prescribed by the Constitution for making them." Columbian Centinel. Massachusetts Federalist (Boston, MA). May 29, 1813.

sub_unit.name: Marlborough
sub_unit.note: Joseph B. Varnum received 1 vote as Joseph Varnum.

sub_unit.name: Franklin
sub_unit.note: Joseph B. Varnum received 19 votes as Joseph Varnum.

sub_unit.name: Walpole
sub_unit.note: The votes from Walpole were rejected.
"No return." Original Election Returns.

sub_unit.name: Denmark
sub_unit.note: "Rec'd 10th May (too late)." Original Election Returns.

"The returns from Malden, Chesterfield and Denmark were not made to the Secretary's office until after the expiration of the time prescribed by the Constitution for making them." Columbian Centinel. Massachusetts Federalist (Boston, MA). May 29, 1813.

sub_unit.note: Joseph B. Varnum received 8 votes as Joseph B. Farnum.

sub_unit.name: Sweden
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Sweden.
Sweden was incorporated February 26, 1813.

sub_unit.name: Berwick
sub_unit.note: The town clerk of Berwick (York), in transcribing the votes to Boston, listed the Republican candidate for Lt. Governor, William B. King, as receiving both the votes for Governor and Lt. Governor. Newspaper accounts list Joseph B. Varnum as receiving the votes in Berwick for Governor.
